If you are a movie snob and enjoy looking for everything that doesn't make sense in a movie then skip it. If you can stream if for cheap or free and have a too hot or too rainy of a day to kill a few hours in then have at it.

I can see not loving this movie but so many people just enjoy hating things anymore.

It won't change your world or make you look at life differently. You won't go "wow, mind blown" at the end.

But what it does is follows the old 90 minute action movie formula and skips trying to get too deep and moves pretty quickly. Adam Driver is pretty good and Ariana Greenblatt does and impressive job.

It has its share of jump scares and a few tense moments.

review_title: Great scares. It felt like a film from a completely different decade, in the best way possible.
review_detailed_main:
This film was a pleasant surprise. It didn't pander to modern politics. It took its time to flesh out the characters. It was a good story for a good story's sake.

Yes, it had flaws. There was some shaky dialogue scenes, that felt stilted. Some character development moments were not exactly timed right etc.

Yet, both protagonist carry the story very well. And you can tell it is written by the same writers as A QUIET PLACE, because the suspense is layered and nuanced. There is a strong theme of family and powerful scenes of grief and growth.

This is a very well done film, even considering it's flaws. But, sadly, in today's day and age, I doubt that it will get the credit it deserves. Go watch it.

65 is an excellent movie for exactly what it is. It's a fun sci-fi popcorn flick that delivers great acting (Adam Driver) fun action and a heartfelt adventure.

It doesn't blow your mind. Or break all the rules. It's just a solid adventure movie. I enjoyed it through its entirety.

The tech that space-adventurer Adam Driver uses is very cool. The violence is visceral. The pain seems real. And the emotions are high.

Adam Driver is an excellent actor. I've never disliked him in anything he's done. Not to say that everything he's done is a masterpiece. But he has been excellent in everything he's been in. Does that make sense?

Watch 65 when you're in the mood for a fun movie you don't have to think too hard about.

review_title: Surprisingly good for usually dead post-Oscar time.

review_detailed_main:
What made me like this film the most was the idea that an intelligent human like civilization was advanced 65 million years ago - most Sci fi takes place in the future or in a time independent context. This film I thought was really thought provoking in that it showed essentially humans from 65 million years ago crashing on Earth, dealing with the elements and animals of the time while struggling to get home. It was tantalizing thinking about such an event happening here so long ago, with such strong personalities and spirt only to lose evidence of it due to the dinosaur killing asteroid which "coincidentally" hit near their crash location.

I love the vibe and feel this give me thinking about their escape and return trip and how all this happened so long before humans came to be and how those strong personalities and their friendship and the love for family are all gone now but existed then.

Many things to critique in this film but I choose to focus on what I liked.

review_title: This movie is boring and lacks dinosaurs

review_detailed_main: I think 65 is a movie that deserves a little higher then what it's given. Adam driver is a likeable character that crash lands on earth after setting off from his wife and child. But because it's 65 million years ago the dinosaurs are his own company. There's also a mysterious girl called Koa that joins him on the adventure. I would have liked to see more dinosaur action but the design of the ones we saw were good and CGI was not bad at all. Mills little gadgets like the little exploading balls and his gun I like to. The spacesuit was not my favourite but still a pretty good scify movie. With something extra that shocked me but was well added.

Didn't initially have much interest in seeing "65" but I ended up being stranded in a city with a couple of hours to kill, so I thought I'd take it in. I don't regret seeing it, it's fine, but I can't imagine that I'm going to remember much about it in a few months' time.

Trying to earn money for his daughter's operation Mills (Adam Driver) agrees to a long-haul space mission, transporting passengers. The ship collides into an unexpected meteor shower and crashes on Earth, breaking up and killing all the passengers save for Mills and a young girl, Koa (Ariana Greenblatt). They try and make it a few miles, to the element of the ship that contains the escape pod, but they've crash landed on Earth 65 million years ago, and the hostile landscape and fearsome creatures form a dangerous impediment.

So, there are positives to it. Visually it's really quite good, for what I can't imagine wasn't an absolutely massive budget. The visually effects of both the creatures and the backgrounds are impressive. Adam Driver is always watchable, and he carries the film well with only Greenblatt to work with (aside from some scenes with his family at the start).

It's just not that particularly interesting a story though. It's almost as if they weren't entirely sure how much of a "B-Movie" they were making, so there isn't quite enough fun, dumb action. Again, it's not bad, there are no elements that you can point to and say, they did a particularly good or bad job, everything is fine, but forgettable.

The movie doesn't really make sense in any regard. From the advanced race using some not very advanced tech to a very weak plot. Adam Driver is not delivering any acting one can relate to. Huffing and puffing with clumsy action attached to it. I felt like fast-forwarding every so often. Acting... mostly weird, not very relevant. Rather boring uninspired story. Weird choices of character's traits - from clothing items to language spoken and communication skills of uneducated person. A movie made for a sake of making movie. There are some scenes which are fun, however I really can't recommend it at all.

review_title: I really enjoyed this... A lot.
review_detailed_main:
I'd read that it was boring and terrible, but I'd like to know what movie those people were watching. I'm a massive fan of dinosaur and sci-fi movies anyway so this was right up my street, yes, it started a little bit slow, but it soon got going and there was plenty of action, I honestly don't know what people want or expect. I like Adam Driver anyway, he was definitely the best thing about the Star Wars sequels, and I wasn't disappointed, he is a very good leading man, and the young girl was brilliant, the CGI was very impressive, I'd say on par with Jurassic World.

So, I'd say this is a great gem of a movie, give it a chance everyone.

review_title: Entertaining but not perfect action, jump scare and child bonding flick.... With dinosaurs

review_detailed_main:
Not too sure why this was presented as a blockbuster film. The concept was a good idea, but the script was just bad. Acting was great. I congratulate Ariana on the transition from network TV to movies, I hope she(and Chloe) gets many more film roles! But I honestly don't see the appeal in Adam Driver as a 'leading man' (for any role).

The Jurassic park fanatic in me would have liked to see more dinos, but I guess limiting themselves to only an hour and 20 minutes may have had something to do with it... Also maybe more pre-lauch content, perhaps flashbacks of Koa and her family too.

Do they test all movies with audiences before release? Do people not have constructive opinions enough to prevent films from being released in this type of lack luster unfinished state? IDK maybe its just me and I'm being too critical. But its a 'MEH' for me.

65 million years ago seatbelt looked exactly the same as now, the same goes for boots, clothing, hairstyle, doors, buttons, and basically everything else. The allians are humans, which supposedly returned to that planned to inhabit it later on? But without any tech and knowledge... Well, whatever. The plot is just braindead. Now the little storyline on the planet is very basic and dry. Overall the while idea is probably made by someone with a mind and IQ of a 6 y/o, who thinks space and dinosaurs are so cool so let's join them together into whatever this was. Pathetic writing. It really felt like Adam needed some money to act in such a low quality movie.

I was very much looking forward to this film, good old fashioned adventure sci-fi. I gave up about half way in. I tried, I really tried. But it was just dreadful. Could have been awesome but in my view turned out like a straight to DVD movie. Some questionable VFX along with some scenes that made little to no sense. Boring, it was also very boring. Reminds me of Independence Day 2 - a massive missed opportunity. This is basically a film about dinosaurs and even then it didn't do that very well. The fact that one of the main characters didn't speak any English basically means that it's just poor Adam Driver so has to carry this mess.

65 is the kind of movie that will please people that like simple popcorn movies. Nothing too special or difficult, just some action and if possible great CGI's. Visually 65 is fairly good, it's mainly the reason I was entertained. The plot on the other hand is a bit bland, the writers could have done better. I mean what are the odds you crash on a planet that is facing total devastation the next day you're there? But it could have been worse. The acting is also very simple. It's basically awkward semi-conversations between Adam Driver & Ariana Greenblatt, nothing Oscar winning here. I just like this genre of movies, it's an easy watch with spectacular CGI scenes.

review_title: The trailer was more engaging than the movie
A superb survival movie with dinosaurs thrown in.
review_detailed_main:
After reading all the negative reviews against this film I almost opted to watch something else. I am glad I didn't.

I truly loved this film.

It's not Jurassic Park and I suspect a lot of the negativity against this film comes from disgruntled fans of gore who were expecting to see people being eaten alive and body parts being strewn everywhere.

But that's the whole point of this film. This is a film about survival and the human will and spirit to survive against all odds.

The two lead actors were absolutely superb. Watching the growing father-daughter type relationship develop was truly moving. Any parent could readily identify with the Adam Driver character.

Overall, it was a beautifully shot movie conveying the sheer awe and majesty but also the sheer brutality and cruelty of what must have been late Cretaceous Earth. It is definitely a film which needs to be seen on a big screen to be fully appreciated.

review_title: An Adam Driver Vehicle that worked!, edge of your seat action, stunning Visuals, sad Moments makes for an Entertaining watch!

review_detailed_main:
This had the potential to be a great blockbuster but it failed to deliver. The trailers were far more exciting than the actual film. I'm not sure how hard it was to deliver what the trailer promised. The audience just wanted to see someone with futuristic weapons battle dinosaurs and somehow this film maker did not understand the task of its own film.

The number of interactions between the dinosaurs and the humans were like five. When those interactions did occur they were over before you knew it. This film barely had any action, weak character development and minimal dialogue.

Adam Driver should have been given so much more material considering he is a great actor. Instead he is given a weak father figure role that did not work in the slightest.

This is the second film(Dungeons and Dragon) in which Chloe Coleman plays a daughter and is not convincing in the role.

Arian Greenblatt's character should have been allowed to speak English because she was more annoying than anything. The fact her character was made to speak a different language than that of Adam Driver was pointless.

The few weapons and gadgets that were shown were okay. But as previously mentioned this film did not deliver on anything it promised. There should have been dozens of weapons and gadgets with cool futuristic abilities. This was a project destined to let ones imagination run wild but it went no where.

Anyone thinking of watching this should just skip it. Perhaps in the future there could be a remake with better execution.

review_title: Fierce sci-fi fan here but disappointed!
Good story, jump scares and no politics.
review_detailed_main:
This film was well worth and watch and in fact I will see it again. I give it 7 STARS out of 10. In the middle is slowed down for about 10 minutes. But it held the sci-fi tension to the final scenes. I really liked how is knitted the fiction into the palaeontological and ancient astronaut narrative. It looked good and had some good jump scares in it. No politics of any kind.

I always find Adam Driver to be more of a subdued actor and not much of a leading man. But here he did a pretty good job. I would have preferred to see a more animated actor like Tom Cruise or crazy Nick Cage. Tom would have brought more tension and Nick would have a lot of moments of going all Cage on us.

The effects were exceptional, especially the ending which for the sake of not revealing any spoilers I won't say what it was.

review_title: A Movie You have already Watched
review_detailed_main:
When you start watching this movie, you will soon notice its story and setting seem very familiar. That is because you've watched a dozen of movies of the same story: A man who lost his daughter meets a girl who lost her parents in a crisis situation, and they build trust and help each other for survival. Sounds familiar?

There is absolutely no originality in this movie. It is a mere collection of all the cliches that you've watched in some other movies. The setting is somewhat interesting, but most of the scenes were simply rip off from Jurassic Park. You are better of watching Jurassic Park one more time than watching this movie.

No pun intended and I reckon only one interpretation that the filmmakers were counting on. Drawing conclusions and making a connection to the Dinosaur era a long ... long time ago. Whatever you take from this ... it is rather nicely made. I was surprised that it tanked at the box office. I don't think the movie deserved that. On the other hand, I do understand the fatigue people feel about going to the cinema.

Also there are so many other things to watch - Adam Driver is not foreign to ... Science Fiction (no pun intended). The mixture of drama and "future" and I reckon "past" is quite well done ... don't expect this to challenge Jurassic Park for a top spot or whatever ... just be aware of that and let the movie do its thing ... you may end up liking it.

review_title: Been there, seen that.. too many times! [+48%]
review_detailed_main: The key issue here is how derivative it all feels. The plot, its journey, the characterizations - everything gives you a sense of déjà vu. Adam Driver is a fantastic performer, and that's not the case in question. The writer-director duo of Scott Beck & Bryan Woods (who co-wrote A Quiet Place) should be knowing better, when it comes to establishing connectivity between the film's protagonists and the viewers. Here, it all happens so fast and we're pre-wired to feel for Mills (Driver) because the plot forces you to. The 90-minute setup introduces strange creatures including T-Rexes, but none of it really carries any shock value. There's no doubt that the film remains watchable all through, but it does not feature any memorable scenes or moments, for that matter.

review_title: The last of us in prehistoric time
review_detailed_main:
65 is really correct movie, if you know what the movie wants to show. It haven't a big story with a big truth, just an action with Dinosaurs and badass Adam Driver. But I thought while I watched movie how many rates is better this than Jurassic World any parts. We just want a last of us story in the prehistoric time with so many suspense and action. I wasn't disappointed when the film finished. But I don't think so this movie be memorable for me. This causes why I rated this film 6 star.

P. S. I was really suprised how many strong creepy scene has in movie. Especially the cave scene. I forget breathing a few moment,

review_title: Pitch Black meets After Earth meets A good Dino

review_detailed_main:
Like many, I want to know what exactly is wrong with this movie from the critical comments and ratings? Some say it is unengaging, boring, etc... but yet with no details to why.

This film has a very solid story, simple but solid. It has an emotional element, again a typical one, but one that is relatable and acted out to perfection by Driver as well as the young girl. This sets the film to be more than just mindless CGI action, but with great values and lessons.

The CGI is also on par with some of the other great films. The dinosaurs were realistic, don't look rubbery or fake. I would say they were as good as Jurassic Park series. There are also great scenery shots, beautiful shots.

So what exactly is the problem? It is a good solid film to watch with friends or family on a Saturday night. You will not be disappointed.

7/10, but upping it to an 8 for balance.

review_title: Why'd they have to kill a baby dinosaur

review_detailed_main: Strip Jurassic park series from its story line and developed characters, moments of levity and you get 65. Scenery was forgettable. Didn't forge any new ground and dropped a deuce on classic dinosaur films. I wasn't expecting this to be Land before time. 65 just failed on so many levels. Total of 5 dinosaurs are shown and they are all predictable. This film could have broken new ground but walked the safe path. I might have preferred play crash on an deserted island and facing blind cenémoos mice over this. Epic fail on so many levels. Adam do you cry yourself to sleep for doing this project? I know I would.

review_title: Good idea + Weak Script = No sense.
Good Special Effects Wasted on a Bad Script
review_detailed_main: The only way this can be made watchable is to edit it down to a 60 minutes Outer Limits or Twilight Zone episode. The story had potential but is incomprehensibly weak and it boggles the mind that this mess of a film got released at all. Adam Driver is completely miscast in this role as he has little to say based on the fact there's only two characters and they barely understand each other due to the language barrier between them. The kid exists in this story only to give Driver a Last Action Hero role. It's all so cheap and cheesy and not entertaining in the least. The cinematography is good. Everything else about this film is bad.

review_title: Beautifully visualized dinosaurs that die in a single shot from a gun

review_detailed_main:
65

Do you like survival movies that happen to have some dinosaurs? 65 was directed by Scott Beck and Bryan Woods, they previously wrote A Quiet Place. It stars Adam Driver from Star Wars: The force Awakens, Ariana Greenblatt, Chloe Coleman, Nika King from Euphoria, and Brian Dare.

Mills (Adam Driver), is an alien, who leads an expedition into deep space, unfortunately they crash land due to an asteroid. Besides Mills, the only other survivor is Koa (Ariana Greenblatt). Together they have to get to the escape pod on the ship, all while trying to avoid the dinosaurs and the asteroid headed towards the planet.

Driver, a loving dad, goes on this expedition in order to pay for his daughter's treatment. Greenblatt portrays someone who wants to get back to her family. Sadly for her, her parents died in the crash. Even though they don't speak the same language, they find a way to communicate. Mills and Koa communicate with the little English she knows, and Mills pointing out where they need to go to survive.

Even though Mills and Koa bond during the movie, the lack of dinosaurs was disappointing. The Jurassic Park films have an entire park with numerous dinosaurs, who will try and eat you. Where 65 only has a couple dinosaurs, who never really do anything exciting. 65 isn't as good as Jurassic Park, but the characters make it interesting enough to watch.

I don't understand the negative reviews. It probably has more to do with the way the movie was advertised, verses the actual movie itself. I was expecting some kind of Adam and Eve story with a crashed ship on earth, which this is not.

The effects are well done and not over the top. The landscapes and environment were believable. The actors played their parts well and managed to evoke emotion and communicate even though they couldn't speak the same language. No overly dramatic or wooden acting.

The story could have been fleshed out slightly better. The family background was pieced together late in the story and creates some confusion regarding the amount of time that has passed from the movie opening to the ship crashing (spoiler: it's not the same mission they are talking about in the beginning. It's some time later). It seems to be something even a lot of reviewers missed.

The movie does a great job of lulling you into a sense of calm and then ratcheting up the anxiety and pace with the dinosaurs and other dangers. It has an edge of your seat quality, including the occasional jump scare.

All in all, it was an entertaining movie. Don't overthink it or expect any Oscar nods. I enjoyed it, was never bored and didn't leave the theater regretting the lost money or time. My kids enjoyed it as well.......with my youngest watching through his fingers from the suspense.

I enjoyed this flick. They built up a nice relationship between Driver and his co-star, so it has some heart without getting too corny.

The action held and it had some tense moments - jumped out of my seat once or twice. The landscapes were stunning and the dinosaur effects believable.

I don't want to go to the movies and see the same old stuff rehashed. Refreshing to see something a bit different.

It's not a perfect movie and nor is it trying to be an Oscar contender - just go along for the ride. I don't get the negativity personally (but everyone wants to complain these days I guess....).

review_title: the most meaningful movie i have ever seen
review_detailed_main: This movie is TERRIBLE. Please do not watch it. The movie has no point the characters do not speak or communicate with its other. The protagonist is a good fit for the movie and the general action scenes are boring and fake. I do not aunderstand who and why made that movie what was the point? I literally create an account to write how bad this movie was. Two characters fall into a unknown planet no backstory whatsoever then fight some random dinosaurs and then leave to go somewhere?? No storyline no backstory no point to create a movie like this. I wonder people that put more than 1 star its sad.

"65" is built on a very simple plot with only four characters. Two of the characters are minor, so most of the movie is portrayed with only two characters. And these two characters do not speak the same language, so there is not a whole lot of dialog. I wouldn't be surprised if the entire screen play fit on a few pages of paper. The simple plot involves the two characters traveling 15 kilometers to get to the escape pod part of their crashed ship. And to add to all that, "65" is short; about an hour and a half.

If you know that going in, "65" can still be an enjoyable ride as a suspenseful dinosaur movie. I recommend a good sound system because low bass effects are used a lot; particularly with the rifle. I loved the rifle and how Mills uses controlled single shots to take out oncoming monsters. In nearly every other dinosaur movie, characters will wildly shoot from the hip in full automatic, screaming at the top of their lungs, and then there is zero effect from all that fire power. That always frustrated me.

So, if you just want to be entertained with some dinosaur action, get some popcorn and have a good time.

I wasn't expecting much from the start. I saw the trailer, figured out the meaning of the title, and was expecting to watch The Grey but with dinosaurs.

That didn't happen.

The dinosaurs are incredibly unconvincing. They're rubbery shrinkwrapped monsters with very mediocre vocalizations. Very little effort was made to make them even resemble actual dinosaurs: they act like rubbery alien monsters who can suspend the laws of physics in order to act scary, though the frequent mismatch in size and strength of the dinosaurs makes it difficult to feel intimidated by them-it's too absurd to see what should be (and certainly looks no more than) a thirty-pound theropod act like it's over a hundred pounds.

If the film were otherwise entertaining, the complete lack of attention given to the dinosaurs would be forgiveable. However, the plot is barebones and the action scenes are quite obviously dependent on the dinosaurs, so the inaccuracies and absurdities drag the movie even further down than if it were just set on some random alien planet.

Good nail-biter. From beginning to end. CGI not best, but blended in well. Fast paced, scary, drama, family. Well acted, well directed, well set cinematography. It feels a bit flat though. Possibly because of the two-actor play. Overall its like Outlander (2008). The title "65" is an eluding and misleading number though - the creature anatomy deviates from known paleontology. The story development is reasonably well: From A to B with as many scary moments as can be fit into the timeframe. Overall, 65 is a well-made and entertaining film that is sure to please fans of sci-fi thrillers. It is a film that will leave you thinking about the nature of survival and the importance of hope. So, have fun with phantasy.

Adam Driver delivered a good action performance being that there wasn't much of dialog except trying communicate with other young survivor. This not meant or compared as Jurassic Park or World because the environment is different and survival depends more than just dinosaurs but other elements. There were some plot holes that should had been addressed and could had have some explanations or past scenes on how and why the space travel purpose and family background. You need to see to know what was going on with the lack of reason for the space exploration. Otherwise, the scenes were somewhat dark in both the world and Adam's character. He was too dry in some parts which made it dull until the dinosaurs arrived. It's a family oriented theme, but meant for the family to watch.

review_title: Before the humans... It was humans.
Terrible. Hardly any dialogue. So boring.
review_detailed_main: I thought this movie would be great, the plot seemed decent. However, it turned out to be a massive waste of money; there is hardly any dialogue in the whole movie, there are only four characters and two of them are seen very briefly. One of the main two characters that we see throughout the film doesn't speak English, so there is hardly any speaking through the whole movie. Honestly this movie is so boring. Also a backstory of the main characters life is not shown in enough detail. It reveals a huge occurrence in his life and then foe the rest of the movie it is forgotten about. Don't waste two hours of your life!

Went into this with no expectations although I had seen the trailer. Came out pleasantly surprised! The plot is very intriguing and the pacing was good.

Cinematography very good and the CGI didn't reflect the lowish budget in any way, although I was disappointed in the lack of feathers on the dinosaurs. The minimalist cast works well as the film is basically a two person show.

Action scenes are very exciting, a reasonable amount of tension adds to the mix. The constant threat of the meteor also builds nicely. The dynamics between the two leads grows nicely, if somewhat predictably.

A very solid 3.5 stars.

There is no substance to this movie. It's so nicely filmed and the earth and Dino's look cool but basically nothing happens. Zero character development or story. So confused why this was even made. Better off watching Jurassic park or a space movie that has a plot. Otherwise you are just watching to kill time. We didn't even find out anything in the end. Like if they added an extra 20 minutes and we got to see what happened after they left earth maybe that would've helped.

Now I'm just adding extra words to meet the character requirements. Now I'm just adding extra words to meet the character requirements.

review_title: Turok: The Remake, The Movie, II
Such potential wasted on mediocre writing
review_detailed_main: It was alright... it could have been jaw dropping, the language barrier between Mills and Koa felt unnecessary, the action was good this film had a HUGE story to tell and they missed it! The writers in a mad dash got in there and got out. This scenario had such GREAT potential but faltered unfortunately, the acting was great! It was the plot that was crippled and savagely incarcerated by limitations, the director's and writer's didn't go the extra mile to coin this as the riveting sci-fi it was meant to be. Such genuine unbeknownst territory regarding a plot and yet annoyingly drab, I felt like I bought a bottle of Rémy Martin xo filled with boxed wine...

First of all, this movie got released the same time as two other blockbusters. One of which will likely get all the butts in the seats. That's too bad because this is actually pretty exciting.

Think Jurassic Park but much better and believe me when I say a lot better. This is that rare science fiction action movie that people have tried to make but didn't get it right. Here, they finally not only got it right but they excelled!! Plus, real life marine Adam Driver is top notch in a really exciting movie.

Those special effects are what's selling the movie for sure but I think they're not focusing on is the action. Which is sad too because this is one of the better action movies to come out this decade.

It felt so good that dinosaurs - after the increasingly silly movies of the last 20 years which ridiculed and humiliated them - are restored to what they were in the first Jurassic Park: the brutal and scary rulers of their world. Apart from that, I want to praise the makers not for what they did, but what they didn't do.

First, the movie is 90 minutes long. They have a simple story to tell: two people get stranded on this hostile planet, and need to survive. Thankfully that simplicity was not stretched to epic 120 minute length, thus the tension is kept high, with only few flaws in between.

Second, the typical horror stereotypes are avoided, you know the kind of flicks where you have maybe six survivors and then they are killed one by one, usually you can predict who is next. No waste of superfluous characters here.

Third, they always warn actors not to play along a child co-star, because either she steals all the attention from you, or she is annoying and ruins the movie. But neither has happened here, the action is well balanced and gives Adam Driver enough opportunity to shine. The back story about his daughter also explains why he feels so protective.

Agreed, the movie has its weaknesses too, and you wonder why the two haven't been killed at least 5 times, but altogether it was very entertaining.

review_title: I can't believe high scores for this movie.
Disappointed even on a long plane flight
review_detailed_main: Don't bother watching this, plot holes are huge and obvious, any person can find the discrepancy with what happened and the technology they have, they can do so much as travel through the galaxy but can't avoid a few rocks on the way. It's really hard to keep watching, could probably work for a kid with no expectations but if you watched a few Sci fi before don't bother with this one. Let's say I just skipped several parts of the movie and didn't really miss anything since it's so repetitive, a complete waste of time and shouldn't have watched it unfortunately it was the only movie I downloaded on my phone for the flight.

review_title: A sincere review from a palaeo-nerd's perspective
Adam Driver is on fire, but...
review_detailed_main:
I give Adam Driver a solid 10 for his superb acting skills but I take 4 stars off because of the unengaging plot.

The CGI was absolutely top notch and the overall look of the film as well. I had a lot of fun just watching the visuals. Couldn't have been better.

The music was beautiful. Not in your face but present and moving when it needed to be.

I've never felt so calm wathing a thriller but that is not necessarily a bad thing. It felt very realistic.

The story though was rather dull. But overall the film was not a disappointment at all. It wasn't trying to be something it is not which makes it very enjoyable to watch.

review_title: Good CGI + Adam Driver. The rest just sucks
review_detailed_main:
Besides Adam Driver's face and remarkably good CGI this is quite annoyoing piece of crap. And I kinda knew that from first seconds of the movie which are accompanied by a cheap, pseudo-emotional music score (btw, the music is ALL OVER this flick and its character reminds amateur attempts at scoring computer games to sound 'like movies'). Generally speaking it is composed out of cliches, borrows quite a lot of shots from Jurrasic Park (staging, visual storytelling, visual suspense), but lacks the narrative substance of Spielberg's classic. And those borrowed shots feel 'pinned-down' on the story, like on the corck board - they not fit INTO the story, they seem forced ON TOP of it. And the reason for that could lay in the fact that there's no real character developement here, no mystery in the plot (in terms of the action, and psychologicaly in the area of both protagonists' dynamic), no immersive exposition. We just observe some people doing some stuff. No real life in those characters. At all. It feels like a commercial rather then a movie.

Also editing feels a bit apparent and forced - like there were some reedits done, maybe some cut-outs, or producer's intervention driven by the 'sell-better' factor? Or like there was no vision for the movie's rythm? Don't know, but it feels off. Lots of times.

And what's a bit sad that all that could have been done better, I suppose. The premise of the story, its basic core concept - even with this bit cheesy tear-erupting father-daughter relation - seems legit as for a good sci-fi movie, seems doable more elegantly.

Bottom line: boring, predictable, annoyingly commercial-like emotional soap opera with dinosaurs and Adam Driver.

review_title: Great pacing and suspense, bland story
review_detailed_main:
Everything about this is well executed - great acting, visuals, creatures etc, and moves along at a cracking pace. There are some great scenes of tension that give a real sense of danger and suspense.

Other movies should take note of the focus on the plot, getting right into it after briefly introducing the characters and their motivations. Character development takes place during the story rather than spending unnecessary time setting up side characters and a complex world. Thankful that there are still movies that can easily manage a 90 minute run time and feel complete.

It's a shame that the story is so boring and generic, - it doesn't really hold up to similar movies that have come before it, despite its superior execution.

I love dinosaur films; ever since the BBC's documentary Walking with Dinosaurs I've been into them.

This felt more like a sci-fi thriller with so many more jump-scares than a traditional 'whoa, dinosaur' film. And it does justice to the genre, akin to Alien in my opinion.

Definitely not a 5.7/10 - are people just miserable at the moment or something? What are they comparing it to?

The dinosaurs are much more scary than in the Jurassic Park / World series, and yes, the CGI is brilliant.

I would say Adam Driver could be a bit more humorous, but he is fighting for his life and dealing with a loss, so it's somewhat realistic in that respect.

Perhaps they could've delved more into the world that he comes from, and how he got his place on this expedition and gained a position worth 3x his previous salary. I.e. More of a back story. But because they didn't do this there was much more time for the action sequences on the planet.

Overall 8/10 (maybe a 7 but I have to offset some of these unrealistic negative reviewers...)

It was hard to connect to Adam Drivers character as a husband & father, so little time or effort was put into the development of who he was as a person in the opening scene and almost zero as to who he was a space traveller.

Even less effort was put into who actually Koa was.

The writing was horrific and acting worse!

I can't imagine who thought Adam Driver was right for this role but it bad casting to say the least.

Any other number of actors or even a few actresses could have done so much more for this role, and dialogue, good or bad, would not have been a necessity.

A lot of potential existent with the screen play and it was all lost from beginning to end, the only saving grace is it was shot well with good visual, and audio effects.

As usual the trailer, is actually better than the film CGI incredible, its no Jurassic Park in terms of being believable, but it had guts to begin with that could have been so so much better.

I can see why Adam Driver has decided to take this film on, after Star Wars, and in all fairness he plays the part very well, but theres soo many moments that are like "really" The way the story would have been sold to him to do the film gives it alot of potential, that it could have been very good its not a classic, its not going to be a film you will watch again it did fairly bad on the cinema and can see why, just pleased i didnt go to the cinema to see this, i was lucky to watch it on sky movies, this is why ive given it 3 stars.

The movie had some potential... An astronaut goes on a two year mission so that his sick daughter can afford treatment. He crash lands on a planet seemingly going back in time to 65 million years ago and has to try and get rescued... Already the time thing started to lose sense. Adam Driver did well on many levels, the dinosaurs were engaging and scary, there was even a T-Rex who held a grudge. Clearly a comet was coming to wipe out the dinosaurs so you understood the urgency even if the idea of going forward in time makes no real sense.

But then suddenly the movie ended, you have no idea whether your conclusions on what happens after make sense and it just stops. I mean, I can draw conclusions on what happens with the girl but it really could have used a scene AFTER they returned even if it would have been reminiscent of Face Off.

review_title: Don't know why it exist in the first place
review_detailed_main:
It's a boring, predictable, and irritating movie. If you enjoy almost constant high-pitch 9-year-old girl screams, then this one's for you.

I haven't felt anything while watching it. For me, there was no suspense or drama.

Because we don't get to know the characters better, I could've not cared less about what happened to them.

Of course, the creators of the movie made sure to give us the expected dose of cliches. What? You were expecting one t-rex? No worries. We'll give you two and called it a better movie than Jurassic Park. (It's not.)

Adam Driver makes an effort, but because of the context of the script, he barely gets to act. I never thought of him like a one-man-show, so from my perspective he's no Will Smith in "I Am Legend".

Ariana Greenblatt (the little girl) was decent, but in some ways I felt they could've done more with her. Being upset, refusing to walk, and to communicate in a crisis like that it's not how a 9-year-old behaves.

Moreover the chemistry between the actors was nonexistent. They weren't able to make me feel anything.

Finally, at the end, I haven't felt like I learned something or enjoyed myself in the process. Honestly, I suspect the script was entirely written by AI.

Would I recommend it? Heck, no. I lost my time. Why should you lose yours?

I dont get the negative reviews for this movie, I thought it was decent sci-fi action ?

What stands out in this movie is the visuals and sound which was really captivating. The story was solid - it seems simplistic in the beginning but there is a little more to it that keeps things interesting. Most of all Its not another super hero or remake flick ! Thank goodness. The overall menacing and dark tone of the movie creates an interesting tension that keeps you glued to the screen.

Adam delivers as usual and the girl in this movie is really good too ! You really get the feeling that these characters are in a desperate fight to survive. Not only do they fight for their physical survival , but their spiritual survival as well due to the shared trauma that both characters endure through the movie.

Some solid thrills , action (of course) and some terrifying dinosaurs ! All in all very entertaining survival story. Definitely worth a watch.

review_title: A Nice Change From Jurassic Park Franchise But Still Stumbles.
review_detailed_main:
Watched 65 with Adam Driver(Star Wars,The Last Duel) as Mills, Arianna Greenblat(In The Heights) as Koa, Chloe Coleman(Gunpowder Milkshake) as Nevine, Nika King(Euphoria) as Alya.

I do agree with critics its predictable but its nice to see another Dinosaur film outside Jurassic Park Franchise, Driver did bring his A Game also it was nice the dinosaurs be in between quadripedal and bipedal A Nice Change From Jurassic Park Franchise But Still Stumbles.

Great Score By Chris Bacon(Wednesday) , Cinematography by Salvatore Totino(The Tax Collector) , and Direction By Scott Beck & Bryan Woods(Haunt) A Nice Change From Jurassic Park Franchise But Still Stumbles. 7/10.

This was a pretty awful watch, and one I wouldn't recommend in the slightest. Driver is fine as the lead, but the plot is extremely basic and predictable, with he and his companion predictably overcoming obstacle after unimaginative obstacle to eventually arrive at the film's inexorable conclusion. The premise that these "aliens" from 65 million years ago are exactly like humans is the epitome of lazy Sci-fi writing, and for all their advancement the entire plot hinges on the gaping hole that they apparently couldn't come up with software smart enough to stop their ship or wake the pilot up after sensing an asteroid field. To top it off, the writers/producers then felt the need to invent new dinosaurs because...you know...actual dinosaurs I guess aren't cool enough? And of course, as they were in the habit of ignoring details, they also decided to ignore decades of archaeological research that shows many dinosaur species had fur or feathers, and instead just made them all reptilian.

review_title: Highly Recommend this Movie! What a Blast!
Passable Popcorn Time-Passer...Space Adv. Monsters, Extinction Event, Survival Story
review_detailed_main:
It Seems that a $40 Mil. Budget, these days, is Something of a Trifle,

and Not Garnered Enough Care or Consideration like its $2-300 Upper-Crust Cousins, and the Neglect and Lacking the Heavy-Lifting Needed, and Shows its Vapidity.

The Script, Widely Reported and Scorned, is Reduced to a Shorter than Short Short Story with as Few Words as Possible.

Almost as if Every Word was a Burden and an Irritant to Surpass on its Way to Getting the Thing Done and Released. In a Truncated 93 Min Shorted as if No One Would Notice.

That a Space "Epic/Adventure" with a Crash-Landing on an Alien Planet Full of "Jurassic Park" Creatures Reduced to "Cameos" and "Walk-Ons"...

and a Survival of the Fittest Battle to the Death Alongside a "Ticking-Time-Bomb" (huge asteroid) on an Imminent Collision Course...

Could All Be Entertainingly Done to Satisfaction in a "Word-Free" 93 Minutes with a Cast of 2, A-Lister Adam Driver and a 9 Year-Old Girl.

What is Here, in its Abbreviated Form, is a Good-Looking, Quickly-Paced Race Against some Impressive Raging Prehistoric Beasts,

Environmental Booby-Traps, to Reach One-Half of a Severed Space-Craft on Top of a Mountain.

What is Here Works Fine, Looks Great, and is an Easy-Peezy Picture that is a Popcorn-Time-Passer that is Better than It Should Have Been.

Considering the Off-Handed Handling and Relegated to About as Much Concern and Consideration as an Elaborate Trailer.

What is Here is, Despite Everything Working Against it, is...

Worth a Watch.

Very bland and predictable film. Not bad, but just not original or exciting. Me and my dad predicted almost every big/noticable revelation or action.

Overall very much like if you combined Logan/Last of us with Jurassic Park and set it in a space-age, also adding in quite a bit of silence. A lost girl who needs a sad, shooting surrogate father to survive a suddenly dangerous world.

The characters feel un-developed too. They tried to write them some depth, but in completely cookie-cutter ways so it falls flat. Everything is so straight forward in how it's created, it's just sequence after sequence and then the time has passed.

Scriptwriters gave neither of the two characters any intelligence. Did they have to make the 9 year old girl mute AND dumb, just because she speaks a language other than English? It's insulting to the viewers.

When shot with a gun and wounded, predators (except perhaps bears) will run away so that they can survive to hunt another day. Watch the Discovery channel. Why would dinosaurs be any different? Writers made the dinosaurs as stupid as the main characters.

Plot: this movie has the thinnest of plots with zero twists. It is as boring as an unscented soy wax candle.

This movie is a complete waste of Adam Driver's talent.

This movie had a good concept to it. The storyline was legitimate and the time period made it even more interesting. It also stuck to its genre of being sci-fi. The acting by the two lead actors, and the action scenes were pretty great. The CGI could have been better but definitely not bad where I would dock points for it.

The only issue with this movie was the way some scenes didn't make sense; without giving any spoilers, there were action scenes where the main lead should've died. But obviously because it's a sci-fi action movie, the main lead has to survive and so I wasn't too surprised by it.

review_title: We Stole the Land from the dinosaurs
review_detailed_main:
This movie is such a tragedy. This is indigenous dinosaur land that we stole, here in America.

This movie is all about survival of human life, but as the WEF, Communists, and scholars teach us, human life is worthless and the planet is overpopulated.

The dinosaurs were better people and didn't overpopulate the Earth like humans have. Thankfully, the dinosaurs never voted to make America great again, either, but I heard that smoking too much has been linked to their decline.

So sad to see such animals that never created any war in their lives, suffer at the hands of selfish humans.

This movie has good special effects, but the moral of the story is all wrong. Humans should have been there to save the dinosaurs, just like saving the polar bears.

Adam Driver does what he can with this. The usual Bladded rules apply.

review_title: 6.5 Reasons why this movie is really bad

review_detailed_main:
Not much that hasn't already been said.

Good idea, poorly executed.

I wish someone would make a movie like this where they take the time to build out the world a little bit more.

Not just every living thing is hellbent on murder.

Creatures that will sacrifice themselves to the last member in order to keep on attacking, are old and clichéd in my book. Would love to see a little more imagination in this department.

That being said, I think the movie deserves a 6. There's a whole lot of utter trash out there. I think alot of people judge a movie on their disappointment, rather than its position in comparison to other movies.

review_title: This is not the scifi you are looking for
review_detailed_main:
This movie convinced me diver's only ability is to sit in one spot and use his voice for scary monologues. This movie feels like a weekend project while he had a day off a disney set.

The title is so cryptic. So cool. So edgy. So new world. So tiktok. 65. Just 65. Eh ok. What is behind it? 65 minutes of your life you will never get back. I think the movie is a troll and somebody out there is laughing at anyone who watched even a minute of this.

Cheesy family backstory scene, diver going on some space mission, hypersleep, stuff goes wrong, he wakes up, crash lands, his crew dead alright. It's not original; it is just how badly it is done that is the issue here. Then he goes to basically copy will smiths movie AFTER EARTH which by comparison actually had effort, acting and chemistry in it. This has none. That is correct, everything you hated about AFTER EARTH is here on steroids and cocaine. And jacked up through a collider for extra failure. Amazing!

Moving on, he lands on this dinosaur infested planet and all dinosaurs just want to go and kill him because that's what reptiles apparently do in every movie ever... The he finds a girl (full grown teenager) who apparently crash landed there in the same way he did and they conveniently run into each other right away because it is a very small planet and everybody crash lands there all the time. Just your average galactic crash land pit stop place you know.. yeah.

The rest of the movie is him trying to be a father while dreaming (im not making this up) this girl is his own daughter as he tries to protect her from evil reptiles. Driver jumps off trees, rolls in the mud, goes gi joe on lizards and generally loses fights to nature by slipping and rolling down hills a few times since as i said earlier, he has difficulty with moving from a single spot. It confuses him. And he is such a man he has to carry basically an adult while nothing is wrong with her (while he is beat up worse than rambo in a vietnam mud pit) because she is just so tired.. she probably read the script and checked out midway herself. Cannot blame her.. We get it, he is superdad but that's not his daughter (irl or in the movie) so it's just a little cringe. Especially when you have this teenager written in the movie that is completely useless in every aspect. She is there to just keep him busy and show the public how much of a superdad he is as he flashes back to his own kid on that other planet he left behind before the mission. Imagine dicaprio getting a useless sidekick in the REVENANT that he had to tote around all movie for absolutely no reason? Not much of an appeal there.. but that is what we got here. And the kicker to all that? It is completely meaningless. There is no plot element that is driven by that.. it has no reason for her being there other than somebody deciding this movie needed more than 1 actor in it.

Every scene is just stupid, boring and unimaginative. CGI is normal for 2023 standards, short and clearly low budget as they kept dino screen time to a minimum...

It's just a horrible movie. It has nothing to redeem it.. not a single thing in there is worthy . This could have been a decent movie if it had different cast, writers and producers.

Ok. This is it. I never write reviews but I felt compelled to do so now. I am completely done with the IMDB reviews. A long time I have been focused on what people say about a movie. If it has a low rating I won't watch it. Regularly I watch movies with a high rating and I don't like them. This time I just watched the movie despite of the low rating because I love science fiction. And I liked the trailer. 65 is one of the best movies I have seen this year! Right next to Top Gun and probably Jonh Wick ( have not seen it yet) I don't know why people give this movie a bad rating because it's a very, very good movie. CGI is great, acting is very good and the characters are lovable. Are people over analyzing? People please! From now on I will not be watching movies based on ratings anymore. I am fed up with this. Do you love science fiction? Dim the lights. Get some popcorn and enjoy this great movie! And to all the people who have rated this movie low, go watch some Festival de Cannes movies and rate those! Still 24 minutes left... I am going to enjoy the end.

review_title: Not bad, but could have been so much better!

review_detailed_main:
Like so many movies before it. They add an annoying child whos only purpose is to add conflict, drama, and just generally be a little s***. This completely takes away from the fun aspects of the movie, by literally ruining every possible encounter the main character has through the whole movie. The whole movie just becomes a big long "Get kid out of stupid problem that they got themselves into" This is one of the most annoying cliches you can do in any movie after adding a kid into the mix. Kid doesn't follow directions. Runs toward danger. Runs away from main character. Ignores all directions and just tries to get themselves killed.

Kinda redeems themself at the last 1/4 of the movie. But that annoying kid cliche still annoys me.

review_title: Many lost opportunities in what could have been a Cult Classic.
review_detailed_main:
A story of loss and the need to continue against all odds in the face of it, "65" squanders opportunities to not only be memeable, but to also develop its characters, their homeworld of Somaris, as well as to present its beautiful CGI monsters clearly and properly.

In what seems to be an effort to be sensitive to younger audiences, the directors Scott Beck and Bryan Woods decided to avoid presenting the pivotal scenes of death in the plot and with it, most of the emotion and distress it causes, thus vastly cheapening the story's experience or any value it might have had to the viewer. Their complete lack of spine in the telling is not uncommon in this generation of Hollywood, one which is obsessed with keeping appearances, leaving good impressions and avoiding hurting any feelings. The movie industry is currently swamped in this ideology; a cancer which is nigh impossible to remove since those in power refuse to hire anyone who disagrees, preferring to languish in their echo chambers, unable to see their shortcomings and choosing only to receive praise at every turn.

In a pivotal moment in this movie, when Adam Driver's life is in danger, he delivers every ounce of emotion and determination only for his co-lead to seem uncomfortable instead of involved. This is absolutely a director's choice; one that is weighed down by the need to avoid any controversy. What could have been a story of love for our fellow man, and a richly developed tale of a father becomes anecdotal in the hands of mediocre developers. We cannot easily identify with the characters and they are not sufficiently engaging due to the poor script and presentation (but at no fault of their own).

Furthermore, the exciting and wonderful CGI beasts in the film are presented at odd angels, momentarily and without true love or consideration to the incredible work put into them. So many monster moments could have been fleshed out and given weight, but instead dissipate. One baby dinosaur in the movie could have gone on to be the next Grogu, if the directors would have had any insight. The movie is poorly shot in general, leaving the viewer frustrated and wishing for a better view of the action.

But the greatest loss, in my opinion, was the chance for this movie to become a cult classic thru the use of imaginative language and word play. The fact that the characters speak different languages could have been the premise for some hilarious dialogue, interaction and brevity. Excellent examples of proper use of this premise can be seen in Luc Besson's "The Fifth Element" or Wolfgang Petersen's "Enemy Mine", both of which are meaningful tales that have staying power in the hearts and minds of their audiences.

In conclusion, "65" avoids the chance to be heartfelt and engaging, and thus becomes ignorable; one of many such titles that fade into obscurity.

review_title: The "could have been twist" was already exposed, I dont understand.

review_detailed_main: 65 is a just barely ok movie. It is watchable though. I went in with not very high expectations from what I heard in advance, but I eventually found myself almost enjoying it. I would say probably better to wait until it goes on streaming channels, unless you absolutely need big screen and sound. The main characters played by Adam Driver and young Ariana Greenblatt give fair performances, with Greenblatt turning in a somewhat better performance than Driver. There are some suspense and action sequences. Nothing to write home about though. The big problem is the script, and a story that gets bogged down, with quite a few illogical events. The CGI is kind of meh, considering how good it could have been with perhaps a bigger budget. My opinion, considering what I sat through as the story unfolded, was the ending was a total letdown. See it with lowered expectations and enjoy it as a kind of "B" movie.

Adam Driver and the rest of the mini cast work solid, special effects and production value are alright. I guess 65 will be of more interest for a younger audience, maybe still in their teens, because the story itself provides nothing really new (does anyone still remember Planet of Dinosaurs from 1977 or Voyage to the Prehistoric Planet from 1965?) and is something (I take any bet) some AI would come up if your input are keywords like "write a movie script and use ideas of Jurassic Park, Planet of Dinosaurs, After Earth and Enemy Mine". On top, some of the scenes, like the little girl attacking a beast like a Tyrannosaurus with a stick (a Starship Trooper moment but meant dead serious - because you know, girls can do everything) are plain silly - she (and maybe even a full grown man) would not have any chance to pierce the skin of that kind of beast with just a sharpened stick. Anyway, 65 is not a total fail or crash but somehow rather boring - despite that plot idea right out of pulp wonderland. I guess the fail lies mostly in the attempt to be serious with some drama elements but on the other hand implement some silly scenes like that saving a dinosaur out of "mud" or attacking a mega beast with just a stick. Last words: I just wonder - did some virus destroy any talent on this planet to write and give us some decent story?

review_title: action packed from beginning to end
review_detailed_main:
This movie was filled with suspense, excitement, and action from beginning to end. We are weekly movie goers and after seeing the previews of this movie for weeks, we had been filled with anticipation and left the theater today with expectations exceeded!

The movie actors were brilliantly and thoughtfully well cast with main roles played by Adam Driver, who I believe has played another great role, and as the young, Ariana Greenblatt did so, equally well.

Each thrilling scene kept the entire theater audience sitting at the edge of our seats and made you feel as you were there on that planet along with the characters.

Great movie, just as exciting as the previews...well done!
