review_title: 65 is film about an event that happened 66 million years ago!
review_detailed_main:
However

It's an interesting premise with a slight tongue in cheek - an English speaking human looking alien crash lands on earth 65 million years ago with 23rd century technology dressed in 21st century earth like clothing just in time for the Yucatán Peninsula Chicxulub impact crater to happen a million years early and wipe out the dinosaurs seconds before he's consumed as their midday lunch - no spoilers here - all of this is in trailer and publicity - if you seen 2012 you know how Hollywood does these kind of disaster type movies

The fact that the title is one million years out should tell you quite a bit !

It doesn't quite make the grade but it's okay

So as long as you put any form of logic behind you - it's actually an okay film and has some good moments - it's certainly scary and there are times you'll jump out of your seat so it'll appeal to Jurassic park fans , sci-fi fans and games fans all the same I can see this being a really good escape type game

There's a small touch of father daughter emotion in there albeit surrogated at times but Adam Driver's character Mills was quite emotionally challenged.

Best acting goes to Ariana Greenblatt as Koa her character's adaptation to her surroundings and development made the film.

It's a good length too at only 90 minutes although it felt longer and there were people in theatre near me yawning but they might've been tired rather bored

It's not the best film I've ever seen it's not the worst film I've ever seen it's just somewhere in the middle there's enough in it that's good to make it worth seeing just don't have high expectations and it'll be okay

The only warning is say is that it's not as good as the trailer but that's nothing new.

Average but still worth watching

Pad. A 5/10.

review_title: Good graphics, but everything else so off
For what it is, it's brilliant
review_detailed_main:
Went in not expecting much from the movie and walked out feeling refreshed.

It's a stand alone in its own right. No sequels, no universe, just a movie about space, dinosaurs, and humanoids

This will not win any awards, but as a film I found it fun and will easily fit into my easy watching film rotation.

The biggest con about the movie though. Is the lack of dinosaur screen time. Was looking forward to a little more on that front, but the scenes in the movie were powerful and did get the emotions going a little from time to time.

Not much else to say, just not typing to hit my character limit to submit this.

65....another in a long line of Netflix products where the male lead has to rely on a kid (boy or girl, it doesn't matter) to save them.

The first 45 minutes are pretty good. The CGI is a bit lacking, but this isn't a Hollywood Blockbuster with a $300 million budget (*cough* Indian Jones *cough*). But once the scared little kid develops superhuman running, climbing, and fighting skills, not to mention the ability to sneak around undetected for that "lethal" strike, this movie becomes another joke. I guess it goes against the mainstream these days to expect a survival movie where one character fights to exhaustion to save the other. There's nothing wrong with that. But it is viewed by the media types as patriarchal these days. So, the kid being saved has to one-up the hero and ALWAYS be the one to save the day in the end.

For once I'd like to see a movie where the person being saved and protected chips in a little here or there, but leaves the heavy lifting to the lead.

Because, you can bet if the pilot was a woman, and the child was a boy, that there would have been zero chance he saves her in the end.

review_title: You could do worse during a trip to the theatre
had low expectations due to the rating but this movie is awesome
review_detailed_main: I expected this movie to be kind of bad or at least slow paced and boring due to the really low rating, but it's an awesome movie, i really like how the story plays out and the pace this movie plays out at, when it boils down to the effects, sound effects, camera angles, and the cgi it's just awesome and everything looks great and realistic, it's not too slow paced and doesn't rush things either and it has some really good jump scares that i didnt expect too, i really enjoyed this movie and im very surprised it had such a low rating, definetely deserves higher rating. The only thing that could've been improved maybe was The start of the movie, it felt a bit weird to watch but everything else is great.

If you are into Sci-fi, CGI, Action and dinosaurs then this is a good film for you. Is it a blockbuster?... no but it's an easy watch keeps your eyes locked on the screen and the acting is good.

The film is mostly based around 2 characters Adam Driver who plays Mills and Ariana Greenblatt who plays Koa.

Lots of negative reviews which I don't feel this film deserves, it's a great film for escapism from the world we live in and it's also not 90 minutes you will feel you have wasted of your life...

It is what it is and that's lots of Action, big dinosaurs and lots of boom bang bang what's not to love!

review_title: If you want every movie trope ever, this is for you.
A dumb survival story of the "No, we will have Jurassic Park at home" variety
review_detailed_main:
Hoping to help at least one person avoid wasting away 90 minutes of their life: Please don't fall for the Adam Driver trap. This isn't a film. It's a big, empty nothing with unimpressive dinosaurs (of the paleontologically outdated version).

You think the summary sounds interesting? Yeah, I did too. "Wow, this must be quite a weird sci-fi story". No, there isn't. This is just a mediocre survival half-action film.

It doesn't matter that it happens on the eve of the dinosaurs' extinction. This is just a flashy background, without any connection to the story. It could be a terran ship crash-landing on an alien planet on the eve of its star going supernova. It could be an alien ship crash-landing in Poland on the eve of the Nazi invasion. It could be a helicopter crash-landing in the Indonesian jungle today. It doesn't matter.

The hero is supposed to be extra-terrestrial but he is human and there's no explanation why, as well as no connection made or even implied at all to Earth's evolutionary history.

Even Jurassic Park has deeper meaning than this nothingness.

No, there are no spoilers. The story is exactly what you see happening in the first 10 minutes. No plot twist, nothing to be revealed. It's just a survival movie.

review_title: Just a 'popcorn' movie, no real lasting impressions.

review_detailed_main:
I'm always on the lookout for a new movie plot idea. I have to admit this one was new different and really intrigued me. Therefore it was a must watch for me regardless of any of the reviews.

The movie started out with a lot of promise. It was action packed and really suspenseful. Then it started to drag on a little bit. The majority of the movie seemed to creep by a little slow. Although the action scenes were pretty cool, the plot just seem to meander along, pretty slowly. The ending was kind of abrupt, and I wish they had stretched it out more.

This movie was definitely not a five out of 10 that the IMDb reviews showed. The plot was amazing and the CGI was fantastic. It just moved a little slow for me.

If one is going to buy a film like this, it has to be something that one, in a similar situation, could appreciate. I liked the movie at the beginning. When he lands on the strange planet (Earth at the time of the dinosaurs) it had possibilities. But as soon as he met the one escapee from the pods, it went downhill. There were just too many life or death moments with resolutions that were beyond belief, even in the sci fi world. You pull a dinosaur out of quicksand and then later you pull Adam driver out of quicksand. And didn't those dinos have anything better to do but chase after these two? They seemed so concentrated in one place. And then the conclusion. I didn't know Old Faithful could parboil a giant behemoth. Well, it was a couple of hours killed. So be it. I never expected a masterful presentation, although it could have been so much better with a little imagination.

"65" should be the number of minutes this movie ran instead of 1 hour and 33 minutes.

At it's core this is Jurassic Park with space travellers and no Dino DNA...just the real thing or at least decent CGI.

The makers of "Quiet Place" are behind this picture set 65 million years ago on earth when dinosaurs of all periods roamed our planet apparently.

Even before Sir David Attenborough narrated his first documentary.

Directors/Writers Scott Beck and Bryan Woods team up with "Star Wars" Adam Driver as the pilot of a spaceship carrying passengers in stasis that crash land on a remote planet after surviving an unexpected Meteor Shower.

As if intergalactic weathermen could be any more accurate than the fancy clowns on the nightly news in 2023.

Driver as "Mills" naturally is the only survivor, until he discovers a young passenger named "Koa" (Ariana Greenblatt) and together they set out on a journey by foot to reach an Escape Pod some 15 miles away.

"Koa" by the way means "Warrior" in Hawaiian...which she proves to be as they deal with pre-historic predators...even making a cool spear.

Along the way they encounter all sorts of nasty bugs and life forms in all shapes and sizes that want to eat them for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

"65" is more "After Earth" than "Jurassic Park"...although it steals scenes from both with a little "Kong: Skull Island" & "Deep Impact" thrown in.

I'm no palaeontologist like "Ross" from "Friends", but I'm pretty sure not all the animal and plant life in this movie is accurate to the Cretaceous Period this movie is set in before the giant asteroid more than 10 kilometres across impacted into a shallow ocean and penetrated the Earth's crust down to a depth of several kilometres.

Even knowing all of this is coming at a velocity of 25 kilometres per second "Will" and "Koa" still have time for a deep and meaningful chat prior to blasting off from this Monster infested planet.

Fun Fact: The warning sound made by the ship's computer just after the crash was first used 70 years ago as the sound effect for the Martian walkers, in the 1953 Paramount production of "War of the Worlds." The trailers (as usual) showed all the good bits in advance.

A good April Holiday movie for young families that's more Apocalypse Park than Jurassic.

Seems like they cut away half the movie and decided to cut budget on CGI, when they realised the movie was garbage!

Writers room,.. I have a great plot for a movie!

I makes no sense but..... "Remember dinosaurers?" "Iiii member!" "Remember Raptors?" "iii member" "Remember Kylo Ren?" "iii member"

Everything is "because plot!" And generic jump scares.

The scenes moves from one to another, where they traverse SOMETHING, a rock, a tree, a bush,.. there is no sense of where anyone or anything is!

It just moves from one bad situationen to the next, for no other reason but "plot"!

The CGI Looks like something from 2002.

review_title: Nice, old school action type, entertaining movie
review_detailed_main:
A nice evening movie, quite entertaining. I wonder why people rate it low because of slight inaccuracies (eg. TRex lived 66 million years ago, not 65 🙄). Just make yourself some pop corn and enjoy the movie!

Engaging story, some emotional bits, lots of action. I started watching this movie with very low expectations, due to the reviews read. While I was watching it I was wondering why it was rated in such a mediocre way, thinking I might be up to a ludicrous and disappointing ending. Still, the movie delivered up to the end. The acting is very high level by both main actors. All in all a pretty decent movie!

review_title: This is great family movie! 7 age and up.
review_detailed_main:
Good acting for two people carrying the whole movie. Believable CGI.

Focus on family and the bonds you can from with people who start ou being strangers, and realize your family maybe the only people left in your live.

It deals with loss for both actors, and how they save each other in a hostile environment.

Nothing wrong with letting your children watch this. There's nothing overly gory in the movie.

Music nice. You can see Oregon scenery in the movie.

There's a little intrigue at the end if they with both make it.

Don't let the other reviewers scare you off, you won't be sorry you spend a few hours watch this movie.

You start watching and you think this movie could be good, right from the start good visual effects, a relatively well-known actor and a promising story, and then after a few minutes you realize the limits of idiocy that this movie deals with. So the action takes place in the future, high technology like hibernation chambers, interplanetary drive, high artificial intelligence and a lot of other indicators that say it is super high technology, powerfull scanners, but despite everything the movie starts with a spaceship crashing into an asteroid field because the autopilot couldn't brake or slow down, pure stupidity... The story unfolds too quickly, as if too much action was crammed into a short time. The ending of the film leaves an unfinished impression, and that to me I never like it!

But if you turn off your brain and stop looking for illogicalities, the film is watchable. Wasted great potenitial nothing else!

review_title: Sadly, could not even force myself to finish it
review_detailed_main:
Love Adam Driver, but here, everything is wrong. I went in knowing the critics were bad, so my expectations were low, but I was optimistic.

Characters are not natural or believable, the scenario is shaky at best, just lazy and uninteresting, which is a pity because the premise had potential, were it in more capable hands.

Production value isn't the highest, but I thought it was ok. World building not great, lack of details that would make sense. The choices characters make are often dumb and hair-pulling.

I really don't understand how this got made the way it did. I hope it doesn't tarnish Driver's reputation.

review_title: Not at all a good movie
hopeful, charming, suspenseful at times but doesn't really live up its potential
review_detailed_main: I expected to see some modern Alien wannabe but actually I was surprised by the hopeful plot. Nevertheless, very predictable and nothing special. As usual very believable Adam Driver who manages to make charming relationships with his younger castmates(also very believable performances). You could expect some suspenseful moments in the journey of escaping the planet full of dinosaurs but in the end doesn't really fulfill the potential neither of the genre nor of the story. After I left the cinema, I wondered what was missing, what I needed more and decided that the film was too short and maybe if it was longer could it be more completed, but then I remembered that Gravity is no longer. In conclusion, nothing spectacular but very decent movie with good vibe and elements that could've been better.

review_title: Imagine the last day of the Dinosaurs but with Adam Driver!

review_detailed_main:
Adam Driver alone can't save the movie. Arianna Greenblatt would have been a better asset to the movie if her character could have understand more of what Driver's character was saying. There would have been more interesting dialogue and viewers would be pulled into the movie more.

As it is the 2 make the most of what they are given to work with. The premise of the movie could have been something to really have worked with. Made it a rollercoaster ride to get to the escape pod. I like that the characters both depend on each other. That was the best part.

I gave the movie a 6 and that is being very generous.

I liked this movie better than most reviewers so maybe I'm the problem. Anyway, I thought it was a decent film, kinda like the cheesy stuff I used to watch in the '70s and '80s. I think they blew it on one plot point, though, and that was the death of Driver's daughter. They show him leaving his planet in order to make money for his daughter's life-saving medical procedure. Then, halfway through, they reveal that the daughter died. Uh, why would they throw that in there in a movie that seems like it's striving for a PG rating? It would have been better for their target audience if he and the girl escape earth and then it ends with Koa and his daughter playing together in the surf. Where did the wife go? He takes off on a multi-year run after his daughter dies? Kind of "Netflix-style" writing, if you ask me. But who asked me? Have a good movie summer, everybody...

review_title: What a waste of money. No it's a simple plain movie
review_detailed_main: Literally couldn't stop laughing in the whole movie. It was really a waste of money. There are only 2 people who don't even talk to each other. The whole movie looked so fake and fake emotional drama between a girl and unknown man. Literally no connection between these two. Ending is also utterly useless. Overall i will never ever watch any movie which has less than 6 ratings. I would have saved money to watch shazam or any other. This was a complete non sense movie which is made by two people and does poor acting with poor actions. There is nothing in the movie and the worst part is its not a 2% of jurassic series.

review_title: 65. Other related numbers: Late 1990's-Early 2000's Sci-Fi Love Letter Starring The Greatest Millennial Actor Earns an 8
review_detailed_main:
This movie, about time travel, does not waste the audience's time with a total run time of a quick hour and a half. Actual live action time before the end credits is approximately 1 hour and 25 minutes.

Nice!

Gathering extra cool points, after a beaucoup boffo, and buff action scene to open the movie, the title sequence then almost shockingly hits the screen after fifteen minutes of breakneck footage.

Wicked Awesome!

This movie has what you want and what you love.

This film harkens back 65 million years but also takes us back to a fantastically fun era of film that just seems that long ago.

Starship Troopers? Yes. Pitch Black? Yes. Red Planet? Yes. Mission to Mars? Yes. A Sound of Thunder? Abso-freakin-lutely!

This movie lovingly borrows from all these titles and then some, and in doing so, it thankfully breaks a 21st Century Cinematic Rule that drives me bonkers, and totally makes me squirm in my seat!

Rule #342 of Bad Movies: Kids in Survival/Disaster Films are totally annoying!

The kids in 65, however, and they are half the cast here, are quite the opposite. They are outstanding in their performances. Their presence and purpose is moving and heartfelt.

Chloe Coleman and Ariana Greenblatt go toe to toe with heavyweight and star Adam Driver, a proven performer across all genres.

And here, especially so. All of them are fantastic and believable in their respective roles.

Movies are meant to transport us, lose us in a different world. Entertain us.

65 checks all these boxes.

I want to, and I can't wait, to watch this movie again at home.

This has Sunday Afternoon Movie written all over it.

Middle School kids will love it. Certainly those not familiar with those above mentioned movies.

Older generations, X and beyond, yes, you may have seen something like this before, but it's done again effectively in 65.

We're not dinosaurs yet.

Go see 65 as soon as possible. You're wasting valuable time.

Full disclosure - I didn't watch all of this nonsense but I suffered enough of it to make an informed opinion. It's rubbish. Facile, dumb, irritating, boring irrelevance. We are, of course, used to being re-educated be Americans about their changed version of history to fit their sense of arrogance and entitlement but through the portal of Hollywood they have now taught me that 65 million years ago visitors from another planet spoke with an American accent. They had microwaves too and hoodies. It is of course quite possible that the earth was visited over the billions of years of its existence, by beings from other worlds and we probably cannot imagine what they might have looked like such is the myriad diversity of life but I think we can be sure that if they did, they didn't look like Adam Driver.

review_title: overall i personally really enjoyed the film!

review_detailed_main:
The acting in this movie is stunning. It tells a compelling story about found family and communication that transcends language.

There's just one problem - it is entirely ruined by the opening title cards that tell us that this movie takes place on earth during the age of dinosaurs. (I'm not tagging this as a spoiler because it's literally the opening of the movie.)

As a film about prehistoric earth, which is what it says it is, this movie sucks. The dinosaurs are unrealistic and there are several species that even I know are outside of our current knowledge of the era. The idea that an alien race unrelated to life on earth would be able to breathe the same (or similar) atmosphere as humans is either several decades outdated or ridiculous - take your pick.

BUT THIS MOVIE IS STILL WORTH WATCHING! Just ignore the opening and pretend it's an alien race on an alien planet that just happen to act human and look like prehistoric earth respectively...

If I were Adam Driver, I would try to grab hold of all the copies, physical and digital, of this catastrophe, to destroy them.

It takes a special kind of talent to take together Driver and Dinosaurs and muddle things up to such an extent that it takes supreme will to sit through its 85 minute runtime.

The director of this venture shows this calibre, in oodles.

Within the first 10-15 minutes,mental alarm bells had started ringing because of the amateurish editing and camera work.

There is a child actor, who acts childish and makes you want to scream your head off.

Driver tries hard but is unable to move a fragment of rock, off the mountain of tripe.

Haven't seen such a poorly made film for quite some time.

review_title: A brand new, but underwhelming, take on a dinosaur movie.
65- What? Minutes that will never return !
For lovers of ancient astronauts theme
review_detailed_main:
If you are interested in the theory about ancient astronauts, I would recommend you check this movie out. While it doesn't specifically show human life on Earth seeded by ancient astronauts, the story IS about a ship full of astronauts in ancient times (65 billion years ago).

Since there are no other human beings on Earth besides the main characters of the story, the movie hints two things:

1. Humankind did not originate on Earth through evolution.

2. Humankind originates from another planet.

From these two hints you can draw the conclusion that people from the planet in the movie where humans come from (I forgot the name) will return to Earth one day and found the first civilization on the planet.

There are much to continue to build on in this universe and the movie leaves many thoughts and questions.

The thing that makes this movie stand out from standard ancient astronaut stories is that it is not about some godly, all-wise and all-powerful alien species; it's only about humans, arriving on Earth from outer space. Humans are the aliens here.

review_title: Could have been far better without the kid
What Jurassic Park the later years should have been.
Many Flaws... I liked it though
well there are dinosaurs... that's good, right?
review_detailed_main:
And that's it. OMG, that looks so cool... dinosaurs... asteroids... yay.

I SLEPT IN THE CINEMA AT THE BEGINNING OF THE MOVIE.

The only thing I saw on the big screen was Adam Driver having an accident in a UFO and that was it, the rest of the movie I watch in the comfort of home on my computer. And I wanted to go back in time, to stop myself from wasting my time watching this!

If I wanted to see 2 characters with father x daughter dynamics, in a situation of chaos running away from things that want to kill them, I WOULD WATCH THE LAST OS US!

Boring, uninteresting and slow. A disappointment, because the trailer showed an atmosphere that I loved, but well... the only thing is... huh, dinosaurs? "father and daughter"?

Come on, there are more movies to watch at the cinema; go see anything else, even if it's a documentary, I promise it will be more interesting.

I don't really know how they manage to write a script about a man with a laser rifle fighting dinosaurs boring, but somehow they pulled through.

The plot is incredibly disjointed, with a lot of "and then" storytelling, confusing plans, and virtually nonexistent chemistry. Half the dinosaurs are -at best- taking inspiration from real creatures and at worst might as well be dragons for how well they represent real prehistoric creatures. Not that they're present very often; there's a notable lack of fauna at any given moment onscreen other than the single breed of dinosaur to make an appearance every 20 minutes. The threat of the asteroid coming to end the Mesozoic Era ironically has minimal impact on the plot and is more just a case of set dressing to artificially ramp up tension.

Another major miss is the interaction between the two main human characters, who I will call Adam and Girl because I can't be asked to check their in-movie names. See, Girl speaks what I at least believe to be a sci-fi foreign language, so the two can't properly communicate with each other. So rather than watching the two slowly learning to communicate with each other with clever work arounds and pantomiming, we instead get to watch Adam pull the American tactic of repeating English words to her more slowly and loudly in the hopes that if he says the word well enough it'll somehow push through the language barrier. Which, to his credit, it usually does, alongside some light/confusing pantomiming that in actuality would leave people staring blankly at you or nodding in a "I don't know what you're saying but I'm gonna role with it" kind of way.

Honestly, I'm just shocked this wasn't a direct-to-DVD release. Would not recommend unless you really enjoy watching stupid stuff, and even then you'll be better off watching something else.

review_title: This is a fun summer movie.
review_detailed_main:
An entirely original movie that takes multiple concepts and mixes them into a unique story of survival and collaboration between a man a child who become stranded on earth 65 million years ago.

Non-stop action and cringeworthy moments as Murphy's law throws everything possible in the way to prevent them from reaching their ultimate goal.

A dash of alien explorers and Jurassic park, make this an a great summer theater movie for 2023.

Some of the child acting and story could have been a tad bit better, but it works, has nice cinematography, and some great moments.

As someone who has attended film school where I had to analyze tons of movies, screenplays and worked on lots of productions, this movie hits enough of the key elements to make it to my highly recommended watch list.

I enjoyed watching it.

review_title: Oh boy, that was a tough watch
Fresh Take on Dinosaur movies!! Underserved Flak
review_detailed_main: I found the movie enjoyable throughout all the cool sci-fi tech to the fresh take on a dinosaur movie. Actions scenes were cool and gripping. The character bits throughout felt realistic and let me connect with them on a deeper and more personal level throughout their journey on prehistoric Earth. The world also made me wanting to know more about Mill's civilization. Definitely would recommend if you are interested in something fresh and entertaining. Another great addition to Adam Driver's film catalog. Truly a great actor and he definitely doesn't disappoint in this even though it is an action film. He hits those important character moment flawlessly. Definitely think this film is getting some flak for no reason. CGI was perfectly good. Lastly, you have to see this in a theater to get that cinema experience, especially for something that happens at the end. Enjoy it!

review_title: A high concept premise is let down by a turgid pace, flat characters, and overly sparing usage of dinosaurs.
review_detailed_main:
On the planet Somaris, pilot Mills (Adam Driver) takes a two year contract on an exploratory mission to earn money needed for his ill daughter's operation. However, when a rogue asteroid field strikes their ship, Mills crash lands the vessel on an uncharted planet (which as it turns out is Earth 65 million years ago, during the Cretaceous period). While seemingly all the cryo pods were destroyed in the crash leaving Mills alone, it turns out one pod survived belonging to a nine-year old named Koa (Ariana Greenblatt) who doesn't speak Mills language but with her in two Mills sets out to find the other half of the ship in order to contact rescuers and escape the planet while contending with various hazards.

65 is the long awaited film from A Quiet Place creators Scott Beck and Bryan Woods that was developed under strict confidentiality with Sony Pictures during September 2020 with Adam Driver to star. Despite initially being positioned as a high profile project, the film was bounced around the release calendar with its initial date for April-May of 2022 missed until it was released in March 2023 where it opened to both lukewarm box office and critical and audience response. Upon the initial trailer I will say I was somewhat curious what they would do with a premise like this, but unfortunately the movie squanders its high concept premise of "Aliens vs. Dinosaurs" with a sodden and rather dull approach that barely musters much enthusiasm.

I think the biggest thing that holds this movie back is the fact that there are only two characters in this movie (more like one and a half, but we'll get to that) and this seems like it was done purely for reasons relating to the Covid pandemic when it was greenlit, not unlike the Idris Elba movie Beast. In order for something like this to work you need to either have a single character become more desperate to survive with each passing moment or have a large ensemble (similar to Aliens) where they're picked off one by one to up the stakes. Driver is a good actor, but Mills is such a stick figure of a protagonist he barely leaves an impression, but at least he leaves more than Ariana Greenblatt's Koa who isn't so much a character as she is an "objective" or cargo for Mills to carry especially since she speaks a made-up language and doesn't have much of a personality aside from needing to be protected by Mills. I don't think Ariana is to blame for the character as it's hard for any actor to give much meat to a role where they're speaking a made-up language so this feels like a fault more in the writing than the acting. In terms of special effects, the Dinosaurs look fine all things considered, but the fact that this is yet another PG-13 dinosaur movie only serves to remind you of how played out these takes on dinosaurs have become especially with the increasingly mediocre Jurassic World films that Universal kept popping out. I'm not saying the movie would've been improved by an R-rating, but it at least would've given something to differentiate itself from the prior dinosaur movies that came before it.

65 promises high concept genre nonsense, but is so turgid and lugubriously paced it sucks what fun there is to be had out leaving us with dull tedium. None of the characters are all that memorable and while the CGI on the dinosaurs is fine there's nothing that really stands out about the sequences especially since they're played just as safe as the PG-13 Jurassic World films that were already running out of ways to make dino attacks interesting. If we do end up getting another rendition of "man vs. Dinosaur", at the very least make it R-rated, because at least then you could justify yourself with trashy genre thrills.

review_title: Confused with poor writing and ridiculous story!
review_detailed_main: First of all.....why do these leading actors in movies look homeless.....with the long, greasy hair....more John Wick? So the camera work, make up, special effects, animation, and the acting are fine......the major problem that makes it a disappointment is the writing....and it took two writers to come up with this ridiculous story line! Aliens who look, act, and talk like humans crash land on Earth....amazingly one day before the mass extinction event, 65 million years ago, that killed all the dinosaurs! Huh? Further....there's zero story beyond crashing.....being chased around by dinosaurs....and taking off again. That's it folks.....in fact this 90 minute movie would have been 85 minutes if they didn't throw in another chase scene at the end. Everything in this movie is preposterous from the crash and how the pieces of the vehicle end up.....to a dinosaur turning the escape vehicle into its proper launch position! If there had been more of a story....there would have been 15-20 minutes more to the movie. This movie rushes through the nonsensical script.....never taking time to set a mood.....and a plan.....for the next move. Lastly.....there are some woke elements....which is bizarre for supposed aliens.....and the acting is a bit melodramatic at times.....probably used as a time filler.

review_title: If you liked Jurassic World you will love this movie.
review_detailed_main: I really enjoyed this movie. The young is an amazing actress and should have a glowing future ahead of her. The main character did really well too. I found their 15 kilometre walk really exciting. The dinosaur CGI was pretty amazing and they all looked so real. The start of the film had a great build up and you soon knew you where on earth sixty five million years ago. The scenes in space where really well done and the crash scene was amazing. You really felt those asteroids hit the ship. I would have liked another ten minutes at the end to tidy a few things up but that was my only complaint. Lots excitement a great story what more would you want.

I think it's slightly underrated.

This is definitely not a very good movie. There are pacing problems even though it's 90 minutes. Not much action, felt awkward at times, not too clever and if you have watched many sci fi movies, you won't find it very interesting.

However, there are some positives. Adam Driver is a great actor, i don't know why some people dislike him so much. Not a big budget production but CGI was excellent. Story is simple but not boring. Viewer cares about these characters, likeable and not annoying. Not much action as i said but there are some intense moments. And the ending was good.

Basically, people disliked it because this is a family movie, suitable even for little kids. I sense that they expected something "heavier", gory, bleak etc. If i am right, i don't believe this is a bad thing. What's wrong with family movies? Should every movie be sad, bleak, twisted and gory? Have we become so desensitized that everything should be dark and painful in order to mirror our world?

This is a light hearted sci fi movie, and to be honest, there is indeed a very sad moment here. Lower your expectations and you will probably enjoy it.

93 minutes of garbage.

A scrappy adventure, shot two years ago and getting unceremoniously dumped, isn't as bad as its backstory would suggest but it's missing something.

A scrappy adventure, shot two years ago and getting unceremoniously dumped, isn't as bad as its backstory would suggest but it's missing something.

A scrappy adventure, shot two years ago and getting unceremoniously dumped, isn't as bad as its backstory would suggest but it's missing something. A scrappy adventure, shot two years ago and getting unceremoniously dumped, isn't as bad as its backstory would suggest but it's missing something.

Repetitive just like this review.

I just don't know what to say or what went wrong here, because clearly something went wrong in the processing of this film. I missed on the first teasers but apparently they hid the conceit of the film to such a degree that reception was very poor and every subsequent trailer went the "Planet of the Apes trailer" route by revealing that it's actually set on Earth, 65 million years ago, and that humans are apparently the aliens to this world.

But nothing is done with this. There's a character who speaks a different language, and Adam Driver's character goes through a list of possible languages he recognizes to compare it to. Nothing is done with this. Little to no attention is paid to the backstory of the film, which had the potential to be infinitely more interesting when combined with Dinosaur-era Earth compared to what we got instead.

What we got instead is a very plain, very boring "we're here and have to get over there" adventure movie with unconvincing CG dinosaurs occasionally attacking for no real reason and absolutely no sense that our heroes are going to fail or die at any point.

This is the kind of movie that could be transplanted into the middle of the Alaskan wilderness at any time between 1820 and 2020 and any and all script changes to be made could be done in less than 15 minutes. It doesn't have an original story, much less a good story, it doesn't have memorable acting or compelling characters, it doesn't have good CG, it doesn't have anything interesting or notable going on for it.

This is the kind of film that a sleazier film company would cancel release after it was finished in order to pocket the tax write-off. And they would probably be justified.

review_title: A spark and then it's all dark
review_detailed_main: It's not easy to pinpoint what didn't work with the movie but there's an emptiness despite all the attempts at making a complete story out of it. The creature feature was the thread that the whole story was hanging from. Story got some sequences that are just unexplainable and doesn't relate like dwelling in dark with a mountain collapsing over the heads. Also the lizard encounters or action sequences are a bit unrealistic. Visuals including special effects are a special plus point recreating both flora and fauna of a lost history. Acting by Adam Driver and Adrianna is excellent. 65's theme is what makes it worth watching.

This is a showcase for CGI and computer generate content... nothing more.

There are some great CGI sequences in this.

Unfortunately the story is horrible. It's entirely, utterly, predictable.

In addition, the story really doesn't make any sense if one just spends a second thinking about it overall. I guess that can be chalked up to being the "mcguffin" as Hitchock used to say. I can only assume producers/writers/directors were all thinking that audiences wouldn't really notice how huge the core plot holes are... and just wanted them to focus on CGI dinosaurs and space scenes.

There's no substance here. It's just a collection of impressive CGI sequences strung together with the thinnest of (clichéd) plot lines.

Acting was.. well.. not great either in my opinion.

I can't help being a bit disappointed with this movie as it is a great premise and is actually the type of movie I should have been excited about, but it felt boring and cliched reminding you of the movies that it copied from but did it all better (Alien, Jurassic Park, Passengers....)

Adam Driver kind of reminds you of a Spanish Conquistador with his sharp features and haircut, and they play on the theme of discovery and language barriers with the girl he finds himself marooned alongside (she cant understand "walk" but "run" is totally understood the first time).

They really could have built a lot more story around this film. The back story is rushed and leaves us with little feelings for the lead characters and little understanding of their world, such as; the spaceship they are in (causing confusion later)? Who is onboard? Why are they there? Where are they going? If it was 40-60 minutes longer it could have made a very engaging story.

.... but that would also require better dialogue and a story more action and less cliches and even a different lead as Adam Driver just does not seem likeable. The suspense and reveal of the location of where they are stuck could have been carried on longer and built up to be a surprise but this is already given to us in the trailer.

Overall, disappointing and fairly average movie that was a nice idea but poorly executed.

6/10.

To start, I am a dinosaur fan, and will always try any dino flick.

65 is really no masterpiece as the plot seems sloppily put together, but it receives too much hate. It is gritty ( well as gritty as TV-12 will allow it to be ), heartfelt, has solid CGI with good cinematography, diverges from the typical dino-movie plot, and it has Adam Driver, who saves the movie from being "meh."

Even though the plot feels underdeveloped and missed many opportunities, it is very fun watch, despite lacking in those departments. As a whole, it is definitely worth the 1h 33m of your life. So watch it by yourself, on family movie night, or even if you just want to see more dinosaurs.

review_title: Pleasantly surprised at how much I liked this movie!
review_detailed_main: I am a sucker for SCI FI movies. This movie maynot be in the likes of Prey, but its quite entertaining. It brings a fresh perspective of what it would feel like to be at the moment when asteroids obliterated all dinosaurs and possibly all life from Earth, 65 Million Years Ago! The famous Extinction Level Event we all know about. I was quite impressed with the subtle flora and fauna changes that can be noticed in the movie. Well there were certainly some weird moments in the movie, I rate a high 8 out of 10 simply because I cant believe how much people are hating this movie. Recommending it for a casual entertaining watch.

Some people find this movie boring. But, I don't. And although there were some plot holes laying around... like, everywhere throughout the movie, I still find it pretty intense. The acting was awesome, Adam Driver doesn't need any introduction. He's a talented actor, everybody knows that. The CGI is pretty good. Watching some T-Rex in action is kinda exhilarating. It's just that there's a HUGE thing that I really can't accept from this movie. Why does the vegetation from 65 million years ago looks exactly the same as it is in present time? Don't you think that you need to add some gigantic plants at least? Where's the effort on vegetation here? So disappointing. At least for me.

... what a waste of a ton of money, talent and time. By talent I mean Driver, who should get another agent, maybe? I mean, do actors read the script before signing up for a movie? This is just so lazy, I can't believe it... I feel whenever the director wanted to make sure, even the last idiot in the audience gets what's going on, Driver's scan/map device starts talking. What happened to show, don't tell? Then there's about every cliche, you've ever encountered... wild animals, dark caves, quicksand, tree drops, literally about everything you've seen a ton of times. And there's no originality in how the protagonists overcome those obstacles... just nothing... it seems someone has googled the most used solutions and the written them down. Oh yeah and jump scares anyone? Who wants to see those anymore? I'm not gonna star about the personal stake Driver's character has... it's so worn-out that I can't bear to describe it. Also I don't want to spoil anything... well, maybe I should... to save you from watching this.

review_title: Nothing special other than an over hyped twist revealed even from the trailer
The team should review a decisive decision-making error and give the visual effects team a pay rise
review_detailed_main: I was actually going to give it a 6.5, but it's not quite right to say it's a 7, so I've ended up giving it a 6, which represents an average film. Firstly, the inclusion of a high-tech human-like civilisation is a good start, although the title is more cool than actually meaningful. If I had to write a story about a spacecraft crashing to a 56 million year old Earth, that's all I'd have to say. But it could have been a much better story with that start, especially with the great visual effects and the great high-tech equipment, and it would have been a much better film if I hadn't decided to continue with the script. The visual effects and the lighting are very commendable, especially the visual effects, which are top notch.

review_title: Could have been better. Meh. Not buying it.
It doesn't re-invent the wheel...and it doesn't have to!
review_detailed_main:
I ended up seeing the movie and while not re-inventing the wheel, as I've mentioned in the title of this review, it doesn't have to. I found "65" to be a pretty entertaining movie, making most of its budget, cast and locations. The budget is blessedly not $450 million dollars or whatever Hollywood keeps spending on its tired, empty and dying blockbusters.

It has pretty good production values and an ideal runtime for this type of movie. It isn't a remake, reboot, sequel or prequel. That is definitely a bonus. Plus, I liked the setting and timing of the movie. Interesting concept. Not perfect by any means. However I saw it has pretty low scores and negative reviews and I am not sure any of it is deserved. But that's just me.

review_title: Interesting premise; mediocre execution despite good special effects
review_detailed_main: OK, I had heard that this was bad, but I still had to see it because I like sci-fi and Adam Driver and he's rarely in a bad movie so I thought I'd take a chance. It's not terrible, but it could have been so much more of an action and an adventure film. As we know it's about a spaceship crashing on an unknown planet and as usually happens in scenarios such as this nearly all of the crew is killed except for our movie star lead, but most unfortunately a little girl survived as well and their relationship together seems all too familiar and as in many films such as this, she is very bright and annoying. There's a scene that you just can't help but laugh at. Their escape pod is upside down and it can't take off, but a big dinosaur right sides it up. They are so helpful sometimes. The pluses, outside of Driver, though he has seen better days, are the special effects which are very good and when and where they land is an interesting concept. I just wish it had been utilized better.

review_title: Adam Driver never forgiven for killing Han Solo
review_detailed_main:
Well let's start with the main star Mr Driver my personal opinion is a very hit and miss actor but who isnt these days ?! Main premises of the film is that the ship as on as the worst GPS in the galaxy that cannot see a on coming meteorite shower till its upon the ship then warns Mills the pilot to avoid but to late so said ship then crashes on a planet So far so good ok then the film then cherry picks from the last 30 odd years of films mainly Jurassic Park and Aliens so nothing ground breaking or new but let's face facts what is?

It's a tiring film with no time for character development cus the target audience only wants action and CGI fast cuts and my personal favourite the next action sequence It's not great but then again it's not The Lighthouse or The Meg which are terrible movies the first why? And the second put Jason Statham in trunks and get the Chinese to pay for it so they look good For 90 minutes of escapism not bad but l do find the really bad reviews really ? Not all films can be Shawshank or Green book lol.

review_title: I just wanted a dino horror
review_detailed_main:
Forced in a family value message in the movie with the "daughter" ... the movie would of done fine if they amped up the horror and thriller aspect of survival. Cant belive i actually paid for this *****.

Another lesson to be learned is to stop casting child or teen actors to high budget movies cause they just ruin the whole mood. I hate that i could see so much sci fi potential just wasted in a post covid era where movies should be aimed at adults to be played in theaters and the holly wood industry is already getting lazy when they could do the bare minimum to go direct to streaming. Wasted potential on the leading actor.

Adam driver is a power house and amazing in this movie. Both actors are great, Dirty Adam driver, family dynamics and dinosaurs what more could someone ask for. I will definitely be seeing this again and purchasing it when it comes out to own.

It gave me some nostalgic Jurassic park vibes and I heard the CGI was iffy but honestly I thought it was amazing. Beck and woods did a fantastic job as well

10/10 will be reccomending it to everyone I know and anyone that will listen to me lol.

I would say beware of jump scares if you scare easily but that is the main warning. You might cry but will definitely laugh.

review_title: This felt like a chop job.
review_detailed_main: This movie had a good premise. It had great names attached. Watching it, to me at least, seemed like the production company chopped it up for the final version. Things would just happen, and you really didn't know how we got there. Driver's character, even with the death of his daughter, just came off like a jerk to her. You didn't feel a real connection, between the two, until the last 20 minutes. No one would write a film that choppy. Maybe we will get a director's cut and it will be much better. The Dinos were so random, and the final "battle," I guess, was only built on 30 seconds of an earlier encounter. It's like seeing a T-Rex in Jurassic Park break out of his pen, but just run off, and you don't see it until the last 5 minutes. This movie needed to be at least creeping towards 2 hours to make it feel whole.

review_title: Cringe acting, not much content, mediocre SFX
review_detailed_main:
A missed opportunity, despite of the potential. My mayor criticism; all devices and practical effects are pretty silly and far away from being believable.

Examples: the video device is way too analogue and.the remote control is totally impractical. The combat rifle looks like a 3D printed plastic toy. The space helmet has an LED stripe in the neck area and is freaking fogging!!! Why??? The guy flies a spaceship to foreign planets and his helmet is fogging! This is ridiculous.

The social behaviour between the guy and the girl (I instantly forgot their names) is not consistent.

The best thing about this movie is it's length. 90 minutes is enough.

Skip this one!

After a catastrophic crash on an unknown planet, pilot Mills quickly discovers he's actually stranded on Earth -- 65 million years ago.

Watch yesterday as I am big fan of Jurassic series , Just went to watch dinosaur as movies is themed about 65millions years back when dinosaur ruled the earth .

Main drawback of this movie according to me is scenes between Dinosaur and humans who land during that period are very short some last for few minutes. Acting by Adam Driver ,Ariana Greenblatt and Chloe Coleman was impressive.

Movie could have been better if few more scenes showing Dinosaur and humans interaction would have been added.

The writers tried to make the movie to feel like nothing is going in the protagonist's way, so they decided to throw everything at him in the hopes we find this movie interesting. Adam Driver is the unluckiest person in the universe in this one. However even his amazing performance and acting abilities couldn't save this movie to become incredibly predictable and bland. It kind of reminds me and feels like a slightly better version of Will Smith's movie After Earth and judging by the scoring on both, I'm not too far off. The VFX on the movie were nice and the scenery looked good and believable, but I think the main problem of this movie is its writing. Such shame, as I really liked The Quiet Place.

You know what this is? This is the type of movie a big movie star makes, it's popular only on the day it comes out and only for the fans of the actor but it will be soon forgotten and maybe surface again in 30-40 years because it's part of the actors legacy...not because of any other merit, artistic or blockbustery.

Not all can be gold. I mean, it wouldn't convince me not even as an idea, how did this get made is beyond me. Did Driver need money? He said that the artistic dramas don't pay well? Maybe he wants to be a blockbuster star!?

Even so, poor action, poor lighting, poor effects, poor script.

The film should put together technology, dinosaurs and action. There is nothing of that, neither story. It is not a long movie, but the first our is the ship crash and a nonsense relation between the man and the girl. Even If they talked the same language It would happen. The visual effects barely exists. There are no tense moments. The dinosaur are extremely rare. It should be way more intense. The elements used are amazing band full of possibilities. It could be something bloke Predator with 10000 BC. The movie it is a huge waste. It doesn't try be anything. The best part is that I didn't watch at the movie :)

Adam Driver delivers an emotional performance. I really felt bad for Mills. His situation really tugged at the heart strings. He was really growing throught it. He went above and beyond to survive.

65 was thrilling and. Suspenseful. The ending was a pleasant surprise. There were moments where I was on the edge of my seat and moments where my heart just could not handle it. It feels like a mix of "The Martian" +"The Last of Us" and "After Earth." (side note: drastically better than "After Earth")

The cinematography is stunning, making it a visually captivating experience.

Overall, a thrilling watch!

review_title: I'm not generally a tearful puddlle of a man. But this ruined me. Over & over.
review_detailed_main: In 25 some-odd years of cheerful IMDbing, this is probably the third review I've felt moved enough to write. Went in with low-to-nil expectations. G*dda**, I love this movie so much it hurts. First of all, the reveal a few minutes in is clever as hell, and although one sees immediately how they've been set up and knocked down like an oblivious, mindless bowling pin, I appreciated the gallstones out of it nonetheless. Well done, most def. But the brilliantly executed emotional ride it then took me on, in amongst a horde of awesomely rendered predatory nightmares which, although great, simply paled in comparison to the little Dad-nostic teeth sawing through my heart..... oh man, I'm so glad I watched this on my own. I would have been humiliated otherwise. Maybe it's just me & the resonance it found with my particular life. Simply put, if you're a dad or at all dad-inclined, stay far away from this masterful piece of business, unless you are guaranteed alone. You have been warned.

review_title: It's a nice "One Time Watch" kind of movie
Not quite absolute garbage, but it's close.
review_detailed_main:
Just from viewing one of the trailers, I had genuine hope that this would be a decent watch. A good SF film to add to the collection. Something to remember.

Well, I was shot down on all three of those hopes, plus a few more that don't even qualify, considering the quality of the film.

With Raimi being associated, I thought that maybe, at the very least, the film would be a fun watch. Unfortunately it's not even that. It's a film that can be shown on the TV, and if you need to do something else - get a drink, a bite to eat, let the dog out, go for a walk, drive a few miles to see a view, go to sleep - you're not going to miss anything. Just save yourself some time, fast forward to the credits, and call it a day. Maybe tomorrow there's going to be something better.

I try to be constructive and what I think is honest but I'm sorry the movie almost has no point in being. The link to earth 65M years ago is irrelevant. It could be a crash land movie anywhere. Clearly Spielberg has copyrighted all dinosaurs so the ones in the movie bare no relevance to anything you have seen (ok a slim resemblance , if we all drew a dino it would look like something) And the obvious scene at the end of the movie youre expecting, to do with family doesn't even materialise. This is basically Will Smiths After Earth, and he got slated. I can watch any and I was actually looking forward to this but genuinely let down. Did it bomb at the cinema. I don't know but jeez if I'd paid £10 to watch this I'd have been robbed.

"65" on Netflix often receives poor ratings, but I have a different opinion. The film adeptly combines elements of science fiction, dinosaur action, and drama, which align with my preferences. In my view, the reviews are overly harsh, and here's why:

Firstly, the visual effects are impressive. The dinosaurs appear realistic, and the incorporation of science fiction elements seamlessly fits into the plot, creating an immersive atmosphere.

Secondly, the acting performances are commendable. The actors convey convincing emotions and enhance the immersion. The lead actress, in particular, excels in her role.

Thirdly, the story offers an intriguing mix of suspense and drama. Character development is well-crafted, and the progression of the plot keeps the audience engaged.

Unfortunately, it has become a trend nowadays to overly criticize Netflix films without giving them a fair chance. "65" deserves more recognition for its quality and originality. I recommend everyone to give this film a chance and see for themselves. It might be a pleasant surprise.
